data.title: What to See in Zagreb | Best attractions and sites in 2024
data.meta_description: Discover the best of Zagreb! From historic landmarks to trendy neighbourhoods, find out what to see in Zagreb with our 2024 attractions guide.
data.text:
If you’re planning a trip to Zagreb, you’re in for a treat! The city is easily accessible from all parts of the world. If you’re coming from America, you can find direct flights from New York to Zagreb with Delta and Croatia Airlines. From Europe, there are many low-cost airlines that operate flights to Zagreb, such as Ryanair, EasyJet, and Wizz Air. If you’re coming from Asia, you can find connecting flights via Istanbul or Vienna.

In addition to air travel, Zagreb is also well-connected by bus, train, and highway. The city’s main bus station is located next to the train station in the city centre and offers both domestic and international connections. Popular bus companies that operate in Croatia include Flixbus, Arriva, and Autotrans. If you prefer to travel by train, Zagreb’s main train station is located in the city centre and offers domestic and international connections to cities throughout Europe.

For those travelling to Zagreb with a vehicle, the city is easily accessible from the A1 highway, which connects Zagreb with other major cities in Croatia, such as Split and Dubrovnik. There are also several other highways that connect Zagreb with neighbouring countries, such as Slovenia and Hungary. If you’re planning to rent a car, there are several car rental companies located at the airport and throughout the city.

Zagreb’s Franjo Tuđman Airport is just 17 km away from the city centre, and you can reach it easily by bus, taxi, or car rental. Whether you’re travelling by air, bus, train, or car, getting to Zagreb is a breeze.

Zagreb is a city with a rich and fascinating history that spans over two thousand years. The city was originally founded by the Romans, and it was known as Andautonia. Throughout the centuries, the city was ruled by various conquerors, including the Hungarians, the Austrians, and the Ottomans. In 1557, the city was declared the capital of Croatia, and it has remained the political and cultural centre of the country ever since.

Today, Zagreb is divided into two parts: the Upper and Lower Town. The Upper Town is the old part of the city, where you can find many historic landmarks, including the iconic St. Mark’s Church with its colourful tiled roof, the Lotrščak Tower, which was once part of the city’s fortifications, and the Stone Gate, which is believed to have miraculous powers. The Upper Town is also home to many museums, art galleries, and theatres.

Lower Town is the modern part of the city, with many shops, restaurants, and cafes. It was built in the 19th century, during the Austro-Hungarian Empire, and it features many beautiful buildings in the Secessionist style. One of the most famous landmarks of the Lower Town is the Croatian National Theatre, which was opened in 1895 and is considered one of the most beautiful theatres in Europe.

Zagreb is also known for its vibrant cultural scene, which includes music, theatre, art, and film. The city hosts many festivals throughout the year, such as the Zagreb Film Festival, the Zagreb Jazz Festival, and the Animafest Zagreb, which is one of the oldest and most respected animation festivals in the world. Additionally, the city has a thriving street art scene, with many murals and graffiti artworks adorning its walls.

Zagreb, the capital city of Croatia, is known for its rich history, beautiful architecture, and vibrant cultural scene. With so many things to see and do, it can be overwhelming for travellers to decide where to start. In this guide, we will take you through the top sights and attractions to see in Zagreb.

From exploring the medieval old town to admiring the stunning art collections, this guide will help you discover the best of what Zagreb has to offer. Whether you’re a first-time visitor or a seasoned traveller, this guide will provide you with valuable insights to help you plan the itinerary and make the most of your trip to Zagreb.
